title: Developer Options
answer:
Users can enable / disable the developer options via the touch switch.

1. USB debugging: Used to enable the debug mode, by which you can debug a mobile phone with the adb command

2. Keep Awake: Used to prevent the screen from sleeping when charging

3. Allow mock location: Used to enable the mock location function

4. Desktop backup password: Used to set the backup password

5. Pointer location: Used to display the current touch data when you touch the screen

6. Display touch operation: Used to provide visual prompt for touch operation

7. Display the CPU usage: Used to display the usage of the current system CPU

8. Force GPU rendering: Used for acceleration with 2D hardware in applications

9. Animation zooming: Used to control the zooming speed

10. Background process limit: Used to limit the number of background processes

11. Display all "Applications are unresponsive": Used to display the "Application is unresponsive" dialog box for background applications.
